topic.title: Configuring the AI Service with a JSON File (Enterprise)

body.p: The Oxygen AI Positron Assistant Enterprise add-on can automatically configure its AI service using a JSON file placed in the installation directory. This method initializes the connector on first start and hides the AI Service Configuration preferences page.

section.title: Configuration File Example

The connector_id can be open-ai-connector, claude-connector, gemini-connector, or azure-connector.

section.title: Behavior on First Start
section.p: When the file is detected, the connector is initialized using its values when starts for the first time. The PluginsOxygen AI Positron Assistant EnterpriseAI Service Configuration preferences page is then hidden. The encrypted key and seed endpoints can be removed afterwards.

section.title: How to Obtain the Encrypted Key
section.p: Install the oxygen-ai-positron-apikey-encryption-addon to generate the encrypted API key. This add-on contributes an Encryption menu with an Encrypt action. Enter the key and a seed in the dialog and it returns the encrypted value. Publish the encrypted key and seed at the URLs referenced in the configuration file.
